forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 60. Southwest wind 8 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a gentle shroud of clouds envelops the landscape, hinting at the arrival of a cool night. The air is crisp and lively, with temperatures settling comfortably around 52 degrees. A brisk southwest wind whispers through the streets, carrying with it just the right amount of chill, while occasional gusts remind us of the city’s untamed coastal essence. Under the cloud-draped sky, visibility may be somewhat diminished, with the iconic Golden Gate Bridge peeking through the mist like a faraway dream. 

Tomorrow promises to unfold with a hint of warmth and brightness, as the clouds begin to part and reveal a partly sunny day. With a high near 60 degrees and a light breeze, it will be a refreshing opportunity to step outside. Given the weather’s capricious nature, layering will be essential; a light sweater over a long-sleeved shirt will suffice for warmth during the cool moments. As you navigate the urban tapestry, consider settling into a cozy café with a book, or perhaps taking a leisurely stroll along the waterfront to embrace the serenity that the evening offers. In such atmospheric conditions, every corner of the city feels alive with possibility, inviting quiet reflections and simple pleasures.
